My time in El Salvador and my experience with the Jesuits has had a profound impact on my life and my work in Congress.

These priests were absolutely dedicated to justice and peace, and were totally and completely committed to the poor. https://www.americamagazine.org/faith/2019/11/06/martyred-jesuits-inspired-work-and-faith-massachusetts-congressman …

What I discovered was deeply disturbing: not only did the high command of the Salvadoran military give the orders, but 19 of the 26 members of the unit that committed the murders had received U.S. taxpayer-funded training at the U.S. Army School of the Americas.

After public outrage, Congressman Joe Moakley, who I worked for at the time, asked me to help lead a commission to investigate what happened and make recommendations to Congress about U.S. policy toward El Salvador.

Fathers Ignacio Ellacuría, “Nacho” Martin-Baró, and Segundo Montes — who I had known and worked with — along with Juan Ramon Moreno, Joaquin López y López, and Amando López were killed for speaking out against a terrible war and for standing up for the poor and marginalized.

In the early morning hours of November 16, 1989, six Jesuit priests, their housekeeper Elba Ramos, and her daughter Celina — both witnesses to what had happened — were murdered by the Salvadoran military in a massacre that shocked the conscience of the world.

Painful but important reminder from @NPR @MorningEdition about this weekend's 30th anniversary of the massacre of six Jesuit priests, their housekeeper and her teenage daughter, who were killed by a group of U.S.-backed soldiers in San Salvador. https://www.npr.org/2019/11/15/779628824/remembering-the-1989-massacre-of-jesuits-in-el-salvador …

Why do we need the ERA? Women can be paid less for the same work, discriminated against for who they are, and are still NOT equal under the law.

It is way, way past time for us to guarantee equal rights for women and ratify the #ERANow.

Here’s what the amendment says: “Equality of rights under the law shall not be denied or abridged by the United States or by any State on account of sex.” It gives Congress the right to enforce the Amendment & says it will take affect in two years.

That’s it.

This is HUGE.

Earlier this month, democrats in Virginia won back the state house and senate. That gives us the 38 states needed to pave the way for ratifying the Equal Rights Amendment. https://twitter.com/HouseJudiciary/status/1194661215475245056 …
